key_insight: Yume-1.5 presents a compact, text-conditioned diffusion framework that enables fast, interactive world generation by shrinking parameter footprint, accelerating sampling, and bounding historical context for real-time text control.
problem_solved: Addresses large model sizes, long inference times, and unbounded historical context in diffusion-based interactive world generation while adding robust text-controlled content editing.
method: Parameter-efficient diffusion backbone: modular/compact architecture to reduce model size and memory footprint.
Accelerated sampling & inference: algorithmic improvements that cut required diffusion steps for real-time responsiveness.
Bounded context & text conditioning: history-compression or memory module plus cross-attention text control to keep interaction state compact and controllable by text prompts.
impact: Makes diffusion-based interactive worlds practical for real-time applications (games, simulation, AR/VR) and lowers compute barriers for practitioners building text-driven, explorable environments.

paper_title: Yume-1.5: A Text-Controlled Interactive World Generation Model
